title: Internationalizing the Law of Secured Credit: Perspectives from the U.S

Gilmore identified eight different personal property security devices used in the United States in the late nineteenth century and early twentieth century. These devices were the pledge, the chattel mortgage, the conditional sale, the trust receipt, the factor's lien, field warehousing, security interests in intangible property, and accounts receivable financing
